records.paper_title: Design of Reconfigurable Radar Signal Processor for Frequency-Modulated Continuous Wave Radar
records.abstract: This paper presents a reconfigurable radar signal processor with configurable FFT and CFAR IPs. The FFT IP supports FFT sizes from 64 to 4096 points. The CFAR IP supports CA, OS, SOOS, and GOOS algorithms.

records.paper_title: An IoT-Integrated IMU Sensor Node for Affordable Crash Detection and Emergency Notification
records.abstract: A low-cost crash detection and emergency alert system using an IMU, ESP32-C3, and smartphone is presented. Crash detection is local, while GPS and SMS alerts are handled by the phone to reduce cost and improve portability.
records.affiliation: Department of Mechanical and Industrial Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, India

co_author.name: S. G. Ganpule
co_author.affiliation: Department of Mechanical and Industrial Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, Roorkee, India

records.paper_title: Computational Analysis of Working and Counter Electrode Gap Influence on Current Density in Laser-Induced Graphene Electrochemical Sensors
records.abstract:
Laser-induced graphene (LIG) has emerged as a promising electrode material for electrochemical sensors due to its high conductivity, tunable surface morphology, and facile fabrication via laser scribing. The geometric configuration of the electrodes—particularly the gap between the working electrode (WE) and counter electrode (CE)—plays a crucial role in determining the current distribution and overall sensor performance. In this study, a computational approach using COMSOL
Multiphysics was employed to investigate the influence of WE–CE spacing on the current density and electric field distribution in a planar LIG-based electrochemical system. The model of the electrode system was constructed using a set of parameters to maintain constant areas of the WE and CE. The electric currents interface, located under the AC/DC module, was used to simulate the working of the planar electrode system, assuming an isotropic and homogeneous electrolyte medium. A parametric sweep was applied to the WE–CE gap, ranging from 0.1 mm to 1.0 mm, while maintaining constant electrode areas. The results revealed that a smaller WE–CE gap produced a higher average current density, whereas a larger gap led to a decrease in current density, providing a critical foundation for the future work that will focus on practical fabrication of the designs to confirm the correlation between simulation outcomes and the practical performance of the electrodes.
records.affiliation: Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engg. Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing Kancheepuram Chennai, India

co_author.name: David Stephen J B
co_author.affiliation: Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engg. Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing Kancheepuram Chennai, India

records.paper_title: VITAL Net: A Hybrid Framework for SpO2 and HR Estimation Using Smartphone rPPG Video
records.abstract: VITAL Net: A Hybrid Framework for SpO2 and HR Estimation Using Smartphone rPPG Video

records.paper_title: Comparative Analysis of Hydrogen Peroxide Detection Using Paper-Based Micropads and Glass Vials
records.abstract: In this work, a comparative study of chemiluminescence-based H2O2 detection is given using two platforms: paper-based micropads and glass vials. Paper micro pads showed better Linear Regression of 0.9788 as compared to vials with 0.9573.
